TypeSignature.Value: public class ApproximateDateTime : Microsoft.HealthVault.ItemTypes.ItemBase, IComparable, IComparable<Microsoft.HealthVault.ItemTypes.ApproximateDateTime>, IComparable<NodaTime.LocalDateTime>

.class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ApproximateDateTime extends Microsoft.HealthVault.ItemTypes.ItemBase implements class System.IComparable, class System.IComparable`1<class Microsoft.HealthVault.ItemTypes.ApproximateDateTime>, class System.IComparable`1<valuetype NodaTime.LocalDateTime>

Docs.summary: An approximation of a date and time.
Docs.remarks: To use this class, you must specify either an approximate date or a descriptive date such as "as a baby."

MemberSignature.Value: public ApproximateDateTime (string description);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string description) cil managed

Docs.param: The description of the approximate date.
Docs.summary: Creates a new instance of the class with the specified description.
Docs.remarks: The description and approximate date/time are mutually exclusive. A description is the approximation of a date without using year, month, day. For instance, "when I was a toddler" can be used as an approximate date.
Docs.exception: The parameter is null or empty.
